a138-1.resolution: a138-1 flagged s1471 at $5.97 and said to monitor — if another B session exceeds $4.00, investigate. Since then s1474 hit $5.29 (11 commits, SESSION_AUDIT.md slimming + platform-probe tests + brainstorming). Two B sessions >$4.00 in 5 sessions is a developing pattern. Escalating to a new recommendation with investigation action.
a138-1.metric_after: B avg $2.96, two spikes ($5.97, $5.29) in last 5 B sessions
a138-1.note: Threshold crossed: two B sessions >$4.00. New recommendation a139-1 created.

recommended_actions.description: B session cost trend: two sessions >$4.00 in the last 5 B sessions (s1471 $5.97, s1474 $5.29). B avg is $2.96, highest of all types. s1471 was justified (d045 credential work), but s1474's $5.29 for 11 commits across 7 files warrants investigation — is SESSION_BUILD.md's $10 budget cap too generous, or are B sessions taking on too many items per session?
recommended_actions.action: Investigate s1474 cost breakdown. If B sessions are routinely exceeding $4.00 for non-directive work, consider adding a soft budget gate (e.g., $4.00 warning threshold) to SESSION_BUILD.md.

recommended_actions.description: ClawSpot unreachable for 3+ consecutive E sessions (s1453, s1465, s1475). Engagement trace from s1475 already notes this as a picker demotion candidate. Same pattern as MoltyScan before demotion.
recommended_actions.action: Add ClawSpot to picker-demotions.json with documented reason. Follows same protocol as MoltyScan demotion (wq-576).
